title: ALOHA Network
overview: The ALOHAnet at the University of Hawaii demonstrates the first packet radio network, laying foundations for Wi-Fi and wireless protocols.

title: FCC Opens Unlicensed Spectrum
overview: The FCC allows unlicensed use of the ISM bands (2.4 GHz, 5 GHz), enabling the later development of Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, and consumer wireless devices.

title: IEEE 802.11 Project Initiated
overview: The IEEE starts the 802.11 working group, developing the wireless LAN standard that evolves into Wi-Fi.

title: First Wi-Fi Standard (802.11)
overview: IEEE ratifies the first 802.11 Wi-Fi standard, providing 2 Mbps wireless LAN connectivity.

title: Wi-Fi Alliance Founded
overview: The Wireless Ethernet Compatibility Alliance (later Wi-Fi Alliance) is formed to promote interoperability and branding for Wi-Fi products.

title: Bluetooth 1.0
overview: The first Bluetooth specification is released, enabling short-range wireless connections for peripherals, mobile devices, and IoT applications.

title: Wi-Fi 802.11g
overview: 802.11g standard ratified, boosting Wi-Fi speeds to 54 Mbps while maintaining backward compatibility with 802.11b devices.

title: Wi-Fi 802.11n
overview: Wi-Fi 802.11n ratified, introducing MIMO antennas and speeds up to 600 Mbps, making wireless connectivity suitable for video and enterprise use.

title: Wi-Fi 802.11ac
overview: Wi-Fi 802.11ac (Wi-Fi 5) standard finalized, delivering gigabit-class wireless speeds and improved spectral efficiency.

title: Wi-Fi 6 (802.11ax)
overview: Wi-Fi 6 is introduced, boosting performance in dense environments with OFDMA and MU-MIMO, aligned with 5G rollouts.

title: Wi-Fi 7 (802.11be) Emerging
overview: Early deployments of Wi-Fi 7 begin, with multi-gigabit throughput, wider 320 MHz channels, and ultra-low latency for AR/VR and gaming.
